abstract: Brahms: The Boy II is a 2020 American supernatural horror film starring Katie Holmes, Ralph Ineson, Christopher Convery and Owain Yeoman. A stand-alone sequel to the 2016 film The Boy, it is directed by William Brent Bell and written by Stacey Menear, the respective director and writer of the original film.
name: Brahms: The Boy II

abstract: The Craft: Legacy (also known as Blumhouse's The Craft: Legacy) is a 2020 American supernatural horror film written and directed by Zoe Lister-Jones. It serves as a soft reboot and direct sequel to 1996's The Craft and stars Cailee Spaeny, Gideon Adlon, Lovie Simone and Zoey Luna as four teenage girls who pursue witchcraft and form a coven. It also stars Nicholas Galitzine, Michelle Monaghan and David Duchovny in supporting roles, while Fairuza Balk reprised her role as Nancy Downs from the first film for a cameo appearance.
starring: --Cailee Spaeny--David Duchovny--Gideon Adlon--Lovie Simone--Michelle Monaghan--Nicholas Galitzine--Zoey Luna
name: The Craft: Legacy

abstract: The Grudge is a 2020 American supernatural horror film written and directed by Nicolas Pesce, and produced by Sam Raimi, Rob Tapert, and Takashige Ichise. At first announced as a reboot of the 2004 American remake and the original 2002 Japanese horror film Ju-On: The Grudge, the film ended up taking place before and during the events of the 2004 film and its two direct sequels, and is the fourth installment in the American The Grudge film series. The film stars Andrea Riseborough, Demián Bichir, John Cho, Betty Gilpin, Lin Shaye, and Jacki Weaver, and follows a police officer who investigates several murders that are seemingly connected to a single house.
starring: --Andrea Riseborough--Betty Gilpin--Demián Bichir--Jacki Weaver--John Cho--Lin Shaye
name: The Grudge

abstract: Peninsula (Korean: 반도; Hanja: 半島; RR: Bando; marketed in North America, British Isles and India as Train to Busan Presents: Peninsula) is a 2020 South Korean action-horror film directed by Yeon Sang-ho. It is a standalone sequel to the 2016 film Train to Busan and follows a soldier who is sent along with his team to retrieve a truck full of money from the wastelands of the Korean peninsula now inhabited by zombies, rogue militia, and a family. The film was released in South Korea on 15 July 2020. It received mixed reviews from critics and has grossed $42.7 million worldwide.
name: Peninsula

abstract: The Old Ways is a 2020 American horror film directed by Christopher Alender. It stars Brigitte Kali Canales as Cristina Lopez, a Mexican-American reporter who returns to her hometown near Veracruz in search of a story on witchcraft. There, she is kidnapped by a group of locals, including a bruja (a female practitioner of witchcraft), who believe her to be possessed by a demon. The Old Ways had its world premiere at the Sitges Film Festival in October 2020.
starring: --AJ Bowen--Andrea Cortés--Brigitte Kali Canales--Julia Vera--Sal Lopez
name: The Old Ways

abstract: Fantasy Island, also known as Blumhouse's Fantasy Island, is a 2020 American supernatural horror film directed and co-written by Jeff Wadlow. Serving both as a horror reimagining and a prequel to ABC's 1977 television series of the same name, it stars Michael Peña, Maggie Q, Lucy Hale, Austin Stowell, Jimmy O. Yang, Ryan Hansen, Portia Doubleday, and Michael Rooker and follows a group of people who, while visiting the eponymous island, discover that their dream fantasies brought to life begin to turn into horrific living nightmares they must try to survive.
starring: --Austin Stowell--Jimmy O. Yang--Lucy Hale--Maggie Q--Michael Peña--Michael Rooker--Portia Doubleday--Ryan Hansen

abstract: The Rental is a 2020 American horror film written, produced and directed by Dave Franco, in his feature directorial debut. It stars Dan Stevens, Alison Brie, Sheila Vand, Jeremy Allen White, and Toby Huss, and follows two couples who begin to suspect they are being watched in the house they rented.

abstract: Nocturne is a 2020 American supernatural horror film written and directed by Zu Quirke. The film stars Sydney Sweeney, Madison Iseman, Jacques Colimon and Ivan Shaw. Jason Blum serves as a producer under his Blumhouse Television banner. The film stars Sweeney as Juliet Lowe, a pianist in her last year of high school who is jealous because she is constantly overshadowed by her twin sister. It was released on October 13, 2020, by Amazon Studios, as the fourth installment in the anthological Welcome to the Blumhouse film series.
name: Nocturne
subjects: 2020 horror films-Amazon Studios films-American films-American supernatural horror films-Blumhouse Productions films-Films produced by Jason Blum

abstract: Skull: The Mask (Portuguese: Skull: A Máscara de Anhangá) is a 2020 slasher film written and directed by Armando Fonseca and Kapel Furman. It stars Natallia Rodrigues as a detective investigating the ancient mask of Anhangá—a vassal of a pre-Columbian god—who is incarnated and embarks on a sacrificial killing spree. The film is an international co-production of Brazil and the United States. Skull: The Mask premiered digitally as part of the Chattanooga Film Festival on 22 May 2020. The film will be made available for streaming on Shudder on 27 May 2021.
name: Skull: The Mask

abstract: Unsubscribe is a 2020 horror film created by filmmaker Christian Nilsson and YouTuber Eric Tabach. It stars Tabach, Charlie Tahan and YouTuber Michelle Khare, and other successful YouTubers like Thomas Brag and Zach Kornfeld. The 29-minute film follows five famous YouTubers who are tricked into joining an online call, only to find themselves stalked and hunted by an internet troll on camera.
name: Unsubscribe

abstract: Violation is a 2020 Canadian drama horror film directed and written by Madeleine Sims-Fewer and Dusty Mancinelli. It is the feature film debut of the two directors, who have collaborated on several short films displayed at film festivals worldwide. The film stars Madeleine Sims-Fewer, Anna Maguire, Jesse LaVercombe, Obi Abili, Jasmin Geljo and Cynthia Ashperger. The film premiered at the 2020 Toronto International Film Festival. It had its US premiere at the 2021 Sundance Film Festival on February 1, 2021.

abstract: Ghost Stories is a 2020 Indian Hindi-language anthology horror film, consisting of four short film segments directed by Karan Johar, Dibakar Banerjee, Zoya Akhtar and Anurag Kashyap. It is co-produced by Ronnie Screwvala and Ashi Dua under their production banner RSVP Movies and Flying Unicorn Entertainment respectively. The film features an ensemble cast including Mrunal Thakur, Avinash Tiwary, Janhvi Kapoor, Raghuvir Yadav, Sobhita Dhulipala, Vijay Varma and Pavail Gulati. It was released on Netflix on January 1, 2020.

abstract: The Turning is a 2020 American supernatural horror film directed by Floria Sigismondi and written by Carey W. Hayes and Chad Hayes. It is a modern adaptation of the 1898 ghost story The Turn of the Screw by Henry James. The film stars Mackenzie Davis, Finn Wolfhard, Brooklynn Prince, and Joely Richardson, and follows a young governess in 1994 who is hired to watch over two children after their parents are killed.

abstract: Unearth is a 2020 American horror film directed and edited by John C. Lyons and Dorota Swies, from a screenplay by Lyons and Kelsey Goldberg. It stars Adrienne Barbeau and Marc Blucas as the respective heads of two neighboring farm families in the rural United States. When one of the families leases their land to a natural gas company, the resulting fracking releases a force that threatens the lives of both families. Alongside Barbeau and Blucas, the film's cast includes P. J. Marshall, Allison McAtee, Rachel McKeon, Monica Wyche, and Brooke Sorenson.
starring: --Adrienne Barbeau--Allison McAtee--Brooke Sorenson--Marc Blucas--Monica Wyche--P. J. Marshall--Rachel McKeon
name: Unearth
subjects: 2020 horror films-American films-American horror films-Environmental films-Films about farmers-Films set in the United States

abstract: The Retreat is a 2020 American horror film written and directed by Bruce Wemple. Set in the Adirondack High Peaks of upstate New York, the film stars Grant Schumacher as Gus, a man who, during a winter backpacking trip with his friend Adam (Dylan Grunn), finds himself tormented by a wendigo. The Retreat was released on DVD and video on demand on November 10, 2020.
name: The Retreat

Anything for Jackson debuted at the Fantasia Film Festival in September 2020 before releasing Shudder the following December. The film received positive reviews from critics.

It follows a female flight officer on a top-secret mission during the Second World War on a Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress while encountering an evil gremlin on board.

abstract: Peninsula (Korean: 반도; Hanja: 半島; RR: Bando; marketed in North America, British Isles and India as Train to Busan Presents: Peninsula) is a 2020 South Korean action-horror film directed by Yeon Sang-ho. It is a standalone sequel to the 2016 film Train to Busan and follows a soldier who is sent along with his team to retrieve a truck full of money from the wastelands of the Korean peninsula now inhabited by zombies, rogue militia, and a family. The film was released in South Korea on 15 July 2020. It received mixed reviews from critics and has grossed $42.7 million worldwide.
name: Peninsula
subjects: 2020 action films-2020 films-2020 horror films-Films directed by Yeon Sang-ho-IFC Films films-IMAX films-Korean-language films-Next Entertainment World films-South Korean action horror films-South Korean action thriller films-South Korean films-South Korean horror thriller films-South Korean post-apocalyptic films-South Korean zombie films

abstract: Anak Ambar is a 2020 Indonesian short horror film. It was directed by Melvin Giovanie and written by Fanny Gunawan. The film tells a story about the belief of a mother who preserve the spirit of her stillbirth child (ambar child) by using attributes. Strange events begin to emerge when she temporarily stays with her eldest daughter, Mita, and Ferry, her son-in-law who does not accept her belief and disallow her to bring the ambar child's attributes into their house. The short film was released on January 15, 2020.
starring: Melvin Giovanie--Ilah Milah--Irene Sonia--Levana Azzahra--Nissy Ariana Meinard--Qory Sandyoriva--Wellyranti
name: Anak Ambar
subjects: 2020 films-2020 horror films-2020 short films-Films set in Indonesia-Films shot in Indonesia-Indonesian films-Indonesian ghost films-Indonesian horror films-Indonesian supernatural horror films

abstract: Ghost Stories is a 2020 Indian Hindi-language anthology horror film, consisting of four short film segments directed by Karan Johar, Dibakar Banerjee, Zoya Akhtar and Anurag Kashyap. It is co-produced by Ronnie Screwvala and Ashi Dua under their production banner RSVP Movies and Flying Unicorn Entertainment respectively. The film features an ensemble cast including Mrunal Thakur, Avinash Tiwary, Janhvi Kapoor, Raghuvir Yadav, Sobhita Dhulipala, Vijay Varma and Pavail Gulati. It was released on Netflix on January 1, 2020.
starring: --Anish Bamne--Pavail Gulati--Avinash Tiwary--Gulshan Devaiah--Janhvi Kapoor--Mrunal Thakur--Raghuvir Yadav--Sobhita Dhulipala--Surekha Sikri
name: Ghost Stories

abstract: Don't Click is a 2020 Canadian horror film that was directed by G-Hey Kim. It screened online at the 2020 FrightFest and stars Valter Skarsgård as a young man who is forced into a nightmarish reality after viewing a snuff film. The film is based on a 2017 short film by the same name created by Kim.
starring: Catherine HowardGeoff MaysMay Grehan--Mark Koufos--Valter Skarsgård
name: Don't Click

name: The Closet

abstract: Bloodthirsty is a Canadian horror film, directed by Amelia Moses and released in to festivals in 2020 and commercially in 2021. It stars Lauren Beatty as Grey, an indie singer-songwriter who begins to transform into a werewolf while working at a remote wilderness recording studio with producer Vaughn (Greg Bryk). The film premiered on October 1, 2020 at the Fantastic Fest in Austin, Texas, and was released on video-on-demand on April 23, 2021.
name: Bloodthirsty
subjects: 2020 LGBT-related films-2020 films-2020 horror films-Canadian LGBT-related films-Canadian films-Canadian werewolf films-Films shot in Edmonton-LGBT-related horror films-Lesbian-related films-Werewolves in film

abstract: Fantasy Island, also known as Blumhouse's Fantasy Island, is a 2020 American supernatural horror film directed and co-written by Jeff Wadlow. Serving both as a horror reimagining and a prequel to ABC's 1977 television series of the same name, it stars Michael Peña, Maggie Q, Lucy Hale, Austin Stowell, Jimmy O. Yang, Ryan Hansen, Portia Doubleday, and Michael Rooker and follows a group of people who, while visiting the eponymous island, discover that their dream fantasies brought to life begin to turn into horrific living nightmares they must try to survive.
starring: --Austin Stowell--Jimmy O. Yang--Lucy Hale--Maggie Q--Michael Peña--Michael Rooker--Portia Doubleday--Ryan Hansen
name: Fantasy Island:

abstract: Violation is a 2020 Canadian drama horror film directed and written by Madeleine Sims-Fewer and Dusty Mancinelli. It is the feature film debut of the two directors, who have collaborated on several short films displayed at film festivals worldwide. The film stars Madeleine Sims-Fewer, Anna Maguire, Jesse LaVercombe, Obi Abili, Jasmin Geljo and Cynthia Ashperger. The film premiered at the 2020 Toronto International Film Festival. It had its US premiere at the 2021 Sundance Film Festival on February 1, 2021.
starring: --Anna Maguire--Cynthia Ashperger--Jasmin Geljo--Jesse LaVercombe--Madeleine Sims-Fewer--Obi Abili
name: Violation
subjects: 2020 directorial debut films-2020 drama films-2020 films-2020 horror films-2020s horror drama films-Canadian films-Canadian horror drama films-Shudder (streaming service) original programming

abstract: Evil Eye is a 2020 American horror film directed by Elan and Rajeev Dassani and written by Madhuri Shekar, based on her Audible Original audio play of the same name. The film stars Sarita Choudhury, Sunita Mani and Omar Maskati. It was executive produced by Jason Blum of Blumhouse Television and Priyanka Chopra of Purple Pebble Pictures. Evil Eye was released on October 13, 2020, by Amazon Studios, as the third installment in the anthological Welcome to the Blumhouse film series.
name: Evil Eye
subjects: 2020 films-2020 horror films-2020s supernatural horror films-Amazon Studios films-American films-American films based on plays-American supernatural horror films-Blumhouse Productions films

abstract: The Old Ways is a 2020 American horror film directed by Christopher Alender. It stars Brigitte Kali Canales as Cristina Lopez, a Mexican-American reporter who returns to her hometown near Veracruz in search of a story on witchcraft. There, she is kidnapped by a group of locals, including a bruja (a female practitioner of witchcraft), who believe her to be possessed by a demon. The Old Ways had its world premiere at the Sitges Film Festival in October 2020.
starring: --AJ Bowen--Andrea Cortés--Brigitte Kali Canales--Julia Vera--Sal Lopez
name: The Old Ways
subjects: 2020 horror films-American films-American horror films-Demons in film-Films about exorcism-Films about witchcraft-Films set in Mexico-Hispanic and Latino American horror films

abstract: The Superdeep (Russian: Кольская сверхглубокая) is a 2020 Russian horror film directed by Arseny Syuhin, based on the real-life Kola Superdeep Borehole. The film focuses on a group of researchers and soldiers who investigate the mystery surrounding reports of a disease outbreak at a secret underground research facility in 1984 Russia.
name: The Superdeep
subjects: 2020 films-2020 horror films-Russian-language films-Russian films-Russian science fiction horror films

abstract: Ghosts of War is a 2020 WWII supernatural horror film written and directed by Eric Bress. The film stars Brenton Thwaites, Theo Rossi, Skylar Astin, Kyle Gallner, and Alan Ritchson. It was released on DirecTV on 18 June 2020.
starring: --Alan Ritchson--Billy Zane--Brenton Thwaites--Kyle Gallner--Shaun Toub--Skylar Astin--Theo Rossi

abstract: Books of Blood is a 2020 American anthology horror film directed by Brannon Braga and co-written by Braga and Adam Simon. It is based on Books of Blood by Clive Barker and the second film adaptation after Book of Blood (2009). The film premiered at the 2020 Screamfest Horror Film Festival on October 6, 2020, and was released on Hulu on October 7, 2020. This was the final production by Touchstone Television before being folded into 20th Television.
name: Books of Blood

abstract: Smiley Face Killers is a 2020 American slasher film directed by Tim Hunter and written by Bret Easton Ellis, loosely based on the Smiley face murder theory. The film stars Ronen Rubinstein, Mia Serafino, and Crispin Glover.
